Proverbs: a bird that flies off the earth and lands on an anthill is still on the ground
Meaning: It is good to stay humble and remember your origins

Proverbs: only a fool tests the depth of a river with no feet
Meaning: You can tell someone is a fool by their actions

Proverbs: examine what is said, not who is speaking
Meaning: Pay attention to what people do not what they say

Proverbs: if you want to know the end, look at the beginning
Meaning: Success is determined by how you start

Proverbs: knowledge is a garden if it isn't cultivated, you can't harvest it
Meaning: To gain knowledge, one must consistently study

Proverbs: a roaring lion kills no game
Meaning: You cannot gain anything by sitting around talking about it. You must get up and work for it.

Proverbs: do not look where you feel look where you slipped
Meaning: Look for the cause of a problem and not the symptoms

Proverbs: restless feet might walk you into a snake pit
Meaning: It is easy for a person to get into trouble when he or she is not busy doing something.

Proverbs: no shortcuts exist to the top of a palm tree
Meaning: If we want to reach the top of our respective goals, we will need to put in the work

Proverbs: when two elephants fight, it is the grass that gets hurt
Meaning: When powerful forces go to war, it's their people who are hurt. Those who never asked for the conflict in the first place are caught, and killed, in the crossfire.

Proverbs: tomorrow belongs to people who prepare for it today
Meaning: Our actions in the present determine if we achieve our goals in the future

Proverbs: no medicine exists that can cure hatred
Meaning: Hatred is a complex and powerful emotion that can be incredle to overcome

Proverbs: all monkeys cannot hang from the same branch
Meaning: Something good will come out of a difficult situation

Proverbs: he who digs a grave for his enemy might as well be digging one for himself
Meaning: Someone that plans harm or misfortune for others may also inadvertently be the recipient of that same misfortune.

Proverbs: even the lion protects himself against flies
Meaning: Always be on your guard and do not let yourself be taken advantage of by anyone or anything.

Proverbs: however long the night, the dawn will break
Meaning: No matter how difficult or dark the current circumstances may seem, there is always the promise of a better future ahead.

Proverbs: if you heal the leg of a person, do not be surprised if they use it to run away
Meaning: Even when we help others, they may not always be grateful and may take advantage of our kindness

Proverbs: the axe forgets but the tree remembers
Meaning: A person hurt in a situation remembers, whereas the person who hurt the other, forgets.

Proverbs: once you carry your own water, you'll remember every drop
Meaning: Experiences in life deepen our appreciation for things we often overlook.

Proverbs: don't set sail on someone else's star
Meaning: Just because someone has been successful at doing something does not mean you will be successful at doing the same thing.

Proverbs: to try and to fail is not laziness
Meaning: Don't be discouraged when you fail, as long as you are. doing something. Use failure as a driving force to push. you forward.

Proverbs: seeing is different than being told
Meaning: Don't mistake hearsay from the truth.

Proverbs: no matter how beautiful and well crafted a coffin might look, it will not make anyone wish for death
Meaning: Material possessions are not as important as life itself.

Proverbs: wood already touched by fire is not hard to set alight
Meaning: With the right preparatory work and conditions, a difficult task can become much easier.

Proverbs: confiding a secret to an unworthy person is like carrying grain in a bag with a hole
Meaning: It is important to choose trustworthy friends.

Proverbs: a feeble effort will not fulfill the self
Meaning: Doing your best is sufficient.

Proverbs: having a good discussion is like having riches
Meaning: Engaging in meaningful conversations and exchanging ideas can be as valuable as wealth or material riches.

Proverbs: don't think there are no crocodiles just because the water is calm
Meaning: Always be aware of your surroundings and different situations.

Proverbs: he who refuses to obey cannot command
Meaning: A good leader should first learn how to follow orders in order to be successful.

Proverbs: do not call a dog with a whip in your hand
Meaning: Approach things with a calm and open mindset.

Proverbs: one falsehood spoils a thousand truths
Meaning: No matter what the situation, it's always better to tell the truth.

Proverbs: the earth is a beehive, we all enter by the same door
Meaning: Regardless of our differences, we all share a common origin and destiny.

Proverbs: rain does not fall on one roof alone
Meaning: Trouble comes to everyone at one point or another.

Proverbs: however far a stream flows, it doesn't forget its origin
Meaning: Always remember your roots and respect your traditions no matter where you are.

Proverbs: if you think you're too small to make a difference, try spending the night with a mosquito
Meaning: Even the most seemingly insignificant beings can make quite a difference to someone.

Proverbs: if there is no enemy within, the enemy outside can do no harm
Meaning: Our greatest enemy is often ourselves.

Proverbs: the eye never forgets what the heart has seen
Meaning: The experiences that deeply affect us emotionally are remembered vividly and lastingly.

Proverbs: no person is born great great people become great when others are sleeping
Meaning: Greatness is earned through effort, not inherited at birth.

Proverbs: when an old man dies, a library is burned with him
Meaning: When an elder passes away, valuable knowledge is lost forever.

Proverbs: truth should be in love and love in truth
Meaning: Genuine love and truth are intertwined and inseparable.

Proverbs: when you marry a monkey for his wealth, the money goes but the monkey remains
Meaning: Marrying for wealth may lead to loss, but the undesirable traits remain.

Proverbs: where there is love, there is no darkness
Meaning: Love illuminates and dispels darkness.

Proverbs: it is better to be loved than to be feared
Meaning: Being loved brings greater happiness than being feared.

Proverbs: when one is in love, a cliff becomes a meadow
Meaning: Love transforms obstacles into opportunities.

Proverbs: he who loves, loves you with your dirt
Meaning: True love accepts imperfections without judgment.

Proverbs: if love is a sickness, patience is the remedy
Meaning: Patience is the cure for love's challenges.

Proverbs: to love someone who doesn't love you is like shaking a tree to make the dew drops fall
Meaning: Unrequited love is futile and unrewarding.

Proverbs: if the full moon loves you, why worry about the stars?
Meaning: Focus on the love you have, not on what you lack.

Proverbs: don't be so in love that you can't tell when it's raining
Meaning: Love remains steadfast even amid change.

Proverbs: even as the archer loves the arrow that flies, so too he loves the bow that remains constant in his hands
Meaning: Love is indiscriminate and falls where it may.

Proverbs: love, like rain, does not choose the grass on which it falls
Meaning: Treat your loved ones with respect and consistency.

Proverbs: do not treat your loved one like a swinging door: you are fond of it but you push it back and forth
Meaning: Love is deaf to gossip and hears only the truth.

Proverbs: love doesn't listen to rumors
Meaning: True love values both the container and its contents.

Proverbs: one who loves the vase, loves also what is inside
Meaning: If someone loves or appreciates something superficial, they also value what is deeper or more meaningful.

Proverbs: one who marries for love alone will have bad days but good nights
Meaning: Marrying for love alone may bring challenges during the day, but intimacy and connection at night.

Proverbs: love for something makes a man blind and deaf
Meaning: When someone is deeply attached or infatuated with something, they may overlook its faults or fail to hear criticism.

Proverbs: let your love be like the misty rain, coming softly but flooding the river
Meaning: Love should be gentle and gradual but have a powerful and transformative effect over time.

Proverbs: the quarrel of lovers is the renewal of love
Meaning: Disagreements and conflicts between lovers can ultimately strengthen their relationship by resolving issues and fostering understanding.

Proverbs: don't try to make someone hate the person he loves for he will go on loving but he will hate you
Meaning: Trying to turn someone against the person they love will only create resentment towards you, not diminish their love for the other person.

Proverbs: if a woman doesn't love you, she calls you brother
Meaning: If a woman doesn't have romantic feelings for a man, she may consider him only as a friend or brother.

Proverbs: love is a despot who spares no one
Meaning: Love can be powerful and controlling, affecting everyone regardless of their status or position.

Proverbs: love doesn't rely on physical features
Meaning: Love is not dependent on physical appearance; it goes beyond superficial features.

Proverbs: if anyone makes you laugh, it is not always because they love you
Meaning: If someone makes you laugh, it doesn't necessarily mean they love you; laughter can have various motivations.

Proverbs: you know who you love but you can't know who loves you
Meaning: While you may know who you love, it's difficult to know who loves you in return.

Proverbs: love is a painkiller
Meaning: Love can provide comfort and relief from pain.

Proverbs: a happy man marries the girl he loves; a happier man loves the girl he married
Meaning: Finding happiness in the person you marry brings greater fulfillment than simply marrying someone you love.

Proverbs: one who plants grapes by the roadside, and one who marries a pretty woman, share the same problem
Meaning: Pursuing superficial things can lead to common problems and challenges.

Proverbs: if money were to be found up in the trees, most people would be married to monkeys
Meaning: Many people prioritize wealth over other qualities when choosing a partner.

Proverbs: every kind of love is love, but self-love is supreme among them
Meaning: While various forms of love exist, self-love is the most important.

Proverbs: true love means what's mine is yours
Meaning: True love involves sharing and sacrifice.

Proverbs: it's better to fall from a tree and break your back than to fall in love and break your heart
Meaning: The pain of a broken heart can be worse than physical injury.

Proverbs: he may say that he loves you, wait and see what he does for you
Meaning: Actions speak louder than words when it comes to demonstrating love.

Proverbs: it is difficult for two long-nosed lovers to kiss
Meaning: Sometimes, physical differences can complicate expressions of love.

Proverbs: a fish and bird may fall in love but the two cannot build a home together
Meaning: Love doesn't hide vulnerabilities or flaws.

Proverbs: lovers do not hide their nakedness
Meaning: Love can change one's perception of the world, making challenges seem less daunting.

Proverbs: when one is in love, a mountain top becomes a flat field
Meaning: Wisdom is valuable and can lead to success.

Proverbs: wisdom is wealth
Meaning: Wisdom is vast and cannot be fully grasped by one individual.

Proverbs: wisdom is like a baobab tree; no one individual can embrace it
Meaning: A wise person listens more than they speak.

Proverbs: the fool speaks, the wise man listens
Meaning: Wisdom is acquired over time through experience and reflection.

Proverbs: wisdom does not come overnight
Meaning: Wise individuals are calm and tranquil.

Proverbs: the heart of the wise man lies quiet like limpid water
Meaning: Wisdom is shared and spread among people.

Proverbs: wisdom is like fire people take it from others
Meaning: Problem-solving often requires wisdom.

Proverbs: only a wise person can solve a difficult problem
Meaning: Knowledge without understanding or insight is worthless.

Proverbs: knowledge without wisdom is like water in the sand
Meaning: In times of crisis, wise individuals find solutions, while fools create further problems.

Proverbs: in the moment of crisis, the wise build bridges, and the foolish build dams
Meaning: Pride can hinder the acquisition of wisdom.

Proverbs: if you are filled with pride, then you will have no room for wisdom
Meaning: Wise individuals find solutions to challenges.

Proverbs: a wise person will always find a way
Meaning: Wisdom is not innate; it's acquired through learning and experience.

Proverbs: nobody is born wise
Meaning: A single day of wise decisions can surpass a lifetime of foolishness.

Proverbs: a man who uses force is afraid of reasoning
Meaning: Mistakes can be valuable learning experiences.

Proverbs: wisdom is not like money to be tied up and hidden
Meaning: The wisdom of others can prevent foolishness.

Proverbs: one who causes others misfortune also teaches them wisdom
Meaning: By the time a fool learns, others may have moved on.

Proverbs: a fool cannot untie the knot tied by a wise man
Meaning: Ignoring facts can lead to unintended consequences.

Proverbs: knowledge without wisdom is like water in the sand
Meaning: Proverbs are designed to impart wisdom to those who listen.

Proverbs: wisdom does not come overnight
Meaning: Actions don't always indicate agreement or consent.

Proverbs: one day in the life of a wise man is worth a fool's entire life
Meaning: Wise individuals think before they speak.

Proverbs: to get lost is to learn the way
Meaning: Ignorance can be more costly than education.

Proverbs: other people's wisdom prevents the king from being called a fool
Meaning: Your body is a vessel for learning and growth.

Proverbs: by the time the fool has learned the game, the players have dispersed
Meaning: A wise person speaks thoughtfully, whereas a fool speaks impulsively.

Proverbs: if you close your eyes to facts, you will learn through accidents
Meaning: Wise individuals plan carefully to avoid unnecessary risks.

Proverbs: the wise create proverbs for fools to learn, not to repeat
Meaning: Adversity can be a powerful teacher.

Proverbs: just because the lizard nods his head, doesn't mean he's in agreement
Meaning: Words can bring about destruction if spoken carelessly.

Proverbs: a wise man fills his head before emptying his mouth
Meaning: Ancestral wisdom is often invaluable.

Proverbs: if you think education is expensive, try ignorance
Meaning: It's better to take decisive action than to hesitate.

Proverbs: your body is a temple of knowledge
Meaning: Deeds are more meaningful than words alone.

Proverbs: a fool has to say something a wise person has something to say
Meaning: People have different areas of expertise and knowledge.

Proverbs: the wise man never takes a step too long for his leg
Meaning: Wise individuals learn from their mistakes and don't repeat them.

Proverbs: give advice, if people don't listen let adversity teach them
Meaning: Family provides support and structure.

Proverbs: a man's ruin lies in his tongue
Meaning: Unity within a family is essential for its strength.

Proverbs: no man can outwit their ancestors
Meaning: Family bonds are resilient but can be flexible.

Proverbs: it is better to live as a lion for one day rather than years as a sheep
Meaning: Harmony within the family is a measure of success.

Proverbs: when deed speaks, words are nothing
Meaning: Cooperation among many leads to success.

Proverbs: he who does not know one thing knows another
Meaning: Children's development is influenced by their upbringing.

Proverbs: a wise person doesn't fall down the same hill twice
Meaning: Children often imitate what they see.

Proverbs: a family is like a forest, when you are outside it is dense, when you are inside you see that each tree has its place
Meaning: Parents aim to provide their children with roots (foundation) and wings (opportunities).

Proverbs: a united family eats from the same plate
Meaning: Family members share resources and experiences.

Proverbs: a family tie is like a tree, it can bend but it cannot break
Meaning: Even those in servitude have familial ties.

Proverbs: if i am in harmony with my family, that's success
Meaning: Interfering in family disputes can be risky.

Proverbs: where there are many, nothing goes wrong
Meaning: Family members are often more concerned about troublesome relatives than the individuals themselves.

Proverbs: a child is what you put into him
Meaning: Educating women benefits entire families and communities.

Proverbs: when you show the child the moon, it sees only your finger
Meaning: A good spouse contributes to the well-being of the family.

Proverbs: we desire to bequeath two things to our children; the first one is roots, the other one is wings
Meaning: Women play a vital role in the household.

Proverbs: a real family eats from the same cornmeal
Meaning: Parental influence extends beyond physical attributes.

Proverbs: even the maid has a family
Meaning: Every mother sees her child as special.

Proverbs: don't meddle with a family feud
Meaning: Community support is essential in raising children.

Proverbs: in a family if you have somebody who is troublesome it's the family members who are more worried than the troublesome member
Meaning: Even a small space can accommodate many friends.

Proverbs: if you educate a man, you educate one person if you educate a woman, you educate a whole family
Meaning: A husband protects and cherishes his wife.

Proverbs: a husband with a good wife will never be on the road without supplies
Meaning: Parents prioritize the well-being of their offspring.

Proverbs: a home without a woman is like a barn without cattle
Meaning: Collaboration leads to greater achievements than working alone.

Proverbs: parents give birth to the body of their children, but not always to their characters
Meaning: Solidarity among people makes them stronger.

Proverbs: every beetle is a gazelle in the eyes of its mother
Meaning: Brothers often share a special bond when they are equally successful.

Proverbs: a mother cannot give birth to something bigger than herself
Meaning: While it's fine to dine with strangers, familial love should be preserved.

Proverbs: it takes a village to raise a child
Meaning: Disownment from one's family is a rare occurrence.

Proverbs: a small house will hold a hundred friends
Meaning: Mutual assistance among relatives can mitigate external challenges.

Proverbs: a woman is a flower in a garden; her husband is the fence around it
Meaning: Misfortune affects families collectively.

Proverbs: the mother hen does not break its own eggs
Meaning: The elderly care for the young, and vice versa, in a cycle of support.

Proverbs: if you want to go fast, go alone if you want to go far, go together
Meaning: Family disputes can lead to inheritance issues.

Proverbs: sticks in a bundle are unbreakable
Meaning: Children are a source of joy and fulfillment.

Proverbs: brothers love each other when they are equally rich
Meaning: Private family matters should be kept within the household.

Proverbs: dine with a stranger but save your love for your family
Meaning: Children respect their parents despite any flaws.

Proverbs: there is no fool who is disowned by his family
Meaning: Families should prioritize each other's well-being.

Proverbs: if relatives help each other, what evil can hurt them?
Meaning: Familial conflicts can be challenging to resolve.

Proverbs: he who earns calamity, eats it with his family
Meaning: The ruler's actions can influence the entire nation.

Proverbs: the old woman looks after the child to grow its teeth and the young one in turn looks after the old woman when she loses her teeth
Meaning: Humility is essential for maintaining relationships.

Proverbs: when brothers fight to the death, a stranger inherits their father's estate
Meaning: Cooperation and collaboration lead to success.

Proverbs: children are the reward of life
Meaning: Learning from past mistakes is important for growth.

Proverbs: home affairs are not talked about on the public square
Meaning: Educating children is a communal effort.

Proverbs: a child does not laugh at the ugliness of his mother
Meaning: Personal experiences shape one's perspective.

Proverbs: family must look out for family
Meaning: Mutual respect is crucial for peaceful coexistence.

Proverbs: it is hard to cure madness that originates in the family
Meaning: Proverbs contain wisdom that can resolve disputes.

Proverbs: when a bitter woman takes over the house, the family she rules is doomed
Meaning: Judging by actions is more accurate than judging by words.

Proverbs: a bird will always use another bird's feathers to feather its own nest
Meaning: Patience and steady progress lead to success.

Proverbs: a person is a person because of other persons
Meaning: Rushing often leads to mistakes.

Proverbs: a man's grave is by the roadside
Meaning: Responding to fire with fire can be effective.

Proverbs: he that digs up a grave for his enemy, may be digging it for himself
Meaning: Retaliation in kind is a common response to offense.

Proverbs: a bad name is like a stigma
Meaning: Individuals are shaped by their interactions with others.

Proverbs: by the time the fool has learned the game, the players have dispersed
Meaning: Collaboration and collective effort yield stronger results.

Proverbs: do not call the forest that shelters you a jungle
Meaning: No one can thrive in isolation.

Proverbs: even though the old man is strong and hearty, he will not live forever
Meaning: Progress comes gradually through steady effort.

Proverbs: fire and gunpowder do not sleep together
Meaning: Intellect is valuable and can improve one's life.

Proverbs: hunger is felt by a slave and hunger is felt by a king
Meaning: Consistent effort leads to significant achievements.

Proverbs: if you are in hiding, don't light a fire
Meaning: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.

Proverbs: it is mr. old-man-monkey who marries mrs. old-woman-monkey
Meaning: Anger can lead to negative outcomes.

Proverbs: it is no shame at all to work for money
Meaning: One's upbringing influences their behavior.

Proverbs: it is the calm and silent water that drowns a man
Meaning: Recognizing patterns is crucial for avoiding mistakes.

Proverbs: it is the fool's sheep that break loose twice
Meaning: Family ties are strong and enduring.

Proverbs: it's a bad child who does not take advice
Meaning: Appearance can be deceptive.

Proverbs: money is sharper than a sword
Meaning: Etiquette is important, especially during meals.

Proverbs: no one tests the depth of a river with both feet
Meaning: Self-praise is often viewed negatively.

Proverbs: one cannot both feast and become rich
Meaning: Hard work is necessary for success.

Proverbs: one falsehood spoils a thousand truths
Meaning: A single lie can discredit numerous truths or undermine trust in vast information.

Proverbs: only when you have crossed the river, can you say the crocodile has a lump on his snout
Meaning: Understanding comes from direct experience; judgment should be reserved until one has firsthand knowledge.

Proverbs: rain beats a leopard's skin, but it does not wash out the spots
Meaning: External influences may impact a person, but they cannot fundamentally change who they are.

Proverbs: the moon moves slowly, but it crosses the town
Meaning: Progress takes time, but eventual achievement is certain.

Proverbs: the poor man and the rich man do not play together
Meaning: Socio-economic disparities often create divides that hinder social interaction.

Proverbs: the ruin of a nation begins in the homes of its people
Meaning: Societal problems often stem from issues within individual households or families.

Proverbs: there is no medicine to cure hatred
Meaning: Hatred cannot be easily eradicated or treated with conventional means.

Proverbs: two small antelopes can beat a big one
Meaning: Collective effort can overcome individual strength or advantage.

Proverbs: what is bad luck for one man is good luck for another
Meaning: Perspectives on fortune vary based on individual circumstances.

Proverbs: when a king has good counselors, his reign is peaceful
Meaning: Wise advisors contribute to effective leadership and stability.

Proverbs: when a man is coming toward you, you need not say: 'come here'
Meaning: Actions speak louder than words; there's no need to state the obvious.

Proverbs: when a man is wealthy, he may wear an old cloth
Meaning: Wealth brings comfort and the freedom to disregard societal expectations.

Proverbs: when a woman is hungry, she says, 'roast something for the children that they might eat'
Meaning: A woman prioritizes her family's needs, even when she herself is hungry.

Proverbs: when the cock is drunk, he forgets about the hawk
Meaning: Overconfidence can lead to overlooking potential dangers.

Proverbs: when the fool is told a proverb, its meaning has to be explained to him
Meaning: Some individuals lack the insight to understand wisdom without explanation.

Proverbs: when you are rich, you are hated; when you are poor, you are despised
Meaning: Jealousy and disdain often accompany both wealth and poverty.

Proverbs: when you follow in the path of your father, you learn to walk like him
Meaning: Children often emulate their parents' behaviors and values.

Proverbs: wood already touched by fire is not hard to set alight
Meaning: Once a precedent is set, it's easier to repeat or continue similar actions.

Proverbs: a chick that will grow into a cock can be spotted the very day it hatches
Meaning: Certain traits or characteristics are evident from an early age.

Proverbs: a child's fingers are not scalded by a piece of hot yam which his mother puts into his palm
Meaning: A mother protects her child from harm, even when she herself is affected.

Proverbs: an old woman is always uneasy when dry bones are mentioned in a proverb
Meaning: Experience brings awareness of potential threats or uncomfortable truths.

Proverbs: a man who pays respect to the great paves the way for his own greatness
Meaning: Showing respect to those in authority or of higher status can lead to personal success.

Proverbs: a proud heart can survive a general failure because such a failure does not prick its pride
Meaning: Pride can shield an individual from the full impact of failure.

Proverbs: as the dog said, 'if i fall down for you and you fall down for me, it is playing'
Meaning: Reciprocity is essential for true cooperation and mutual benefit.

Proverbs: a wise man who knows proverbs, reconciles difficulties (yoruba)
Meaning: Proverbs offer insights that can help resolve conflicts and solve problems.

Proverbs: do not look where you fell, but where you slipped
Meaning: Focus on identifying the root cause of a problem, rather than dwelling on its immediate effects.

Proverbs: if a child washes his hands he could eat with kings
Meaning: Good habits and hygiene can lead to opportunities for advancement.

Proverbs: if you don't stand for something, you will fall for something
Meaning: Having principles and beliefs prevents being swayed or misled by others.

Proverbs: it takes a whole village to raise a child
Meaning: Parenting and upbringing are collaborative efforts that involve the entire community.

Proverbs: looking at a king's mouth one would never think he sucked his mother's breast
Meaning: One's appearance or status can mask their humble origins.

Proverbs: people should not talk while they are eating or pepper may go down the wrong way
Meaning: It's important to observe proper etiquette to avoid discomfort or mishaps.

Proverbs: the lizard that jumped from the high iroko tree to the ground said he would praise himself if no one else did

Proverbs: the mouth which eats does not talk
Meaning: Actions speak louder than words; it's more important to do than to say.

Proverbs: the sun will shine on those who stand before it shines on those who kneel under them
Meaning: Success favors those who take initiative and assert themselves.

Proverbs: those whose palm-kernels were cracked for them by a benevolent spirit should not forget to be humble

Proverbs: when a man says yes, his chi (personal god) says yes also

Proverbs: when the moon is shining the cripple becomes hungry for a walk

Proverbs: you can tell a ripe corn by its look
Meaning: Experience allows one to recognize qualities or attributes without needing further confirmation.

Proverbs: you must judge a man by the work of his hands
Meaning: Judging someone by their actions and accomplishments is more accurate than judging by their words.

Proverbs: slow, slow is the way to go/slowness is the better locomotion

Proverbs: being steady and keen is important when performing given tasks hurry, hurry, has no blessings

Proverbs: more haste less speed
Meaning: Rushing often results in errors and delays.

Proverbs: the remedy for fire is fire

Proverbs: tit for tat

Proverbs: a person is people

Proverbs: no man is an island

Proverbs: nine is near ten
Meaning: Indicates nearing completion or fullness.

Proverbs: intelligence is an asset. knowledge can be used to better ones life

Proverbs: little by little fills up the measure

Proverbs: a great journey is begun by a single mile

Proverbs: anger brings damage
Meaning: Acting out of anger leads to negative consequences.

Proverbs: the child of a snake is a snake

Proverbs: like father like son
Meaning: Children often resemble their parents.

Proverbs: one falsehood spoils a thousand truths
Meaning: A single lie undermines credibility.

Proverbs: only when you have crossed the river, can you say the crocodile has a lump on his snout
Meaning: Don't underestimate a danger until it's fully confronted.

Proverbs: rain beats a leopard's skin, but it does not wash out the spots
Meaning: Adversity may affect someone superficially, but it does not change their true character.

Proverbs: the moon moves slowly, but it crosses the town
Meaning: Progress may seem slow, but with patience and persistence, significant achievements can be made.

Proverbs: the poor man and the rich man do not play together
Meaning: Social classes often remain separate, indicating societal divisions and inequality.

Proverbs: the ruin of a nation begins in the homes of its people
Meaning: Societal problems often originate from individual behaviors and values within families and communities.

Proverbs: there is no medicine to cure hatred
Meaning: Hatred is a deep-rooted emotion that cannot be easily eliminated or cured.

Proverbs: two small antelopes can beat a big one

Proverbs: what is bad luck for one man is good luck for another
Meaning: Circumstances that are unfortunate for one person may benefit another, illustrating the subjective nature of fortune.

Proverbs: when a man is coming toward you, you need not say: 'come here'
Meaning: Actions speak louder than words; unnecessary communication can be avoided.

Proverbs: when a man is wealthy, he may wear an old cloth
Meaning: Wealth allows for certain liberties or eccentricities, such as not conforming to societal expectations.

Proverbs: when a woman is hungry, she says, 'roast something for the children that they might eat'
Meaning: Responsibility for providing for others often takes precedence over personal needs or desires.

Proverbs: when the cock is drunk, he forgets about the hawk
Meaning: Intoxication or unawareness can make someone vulnerable to danger.

Proverbs: when the fool is told a proverb, its meaning has to be explained to him
Meaning: Some individuals lack understanding and require explanations for simple truths or sayings.

Proverbs: when you are rich, you are hated; when you are poor, you are despised
Meaning: Jealousy and resentment exist regardless of social or financial status.

Proverbs: when you follow in the path of your father, you learn to walk like him
Meaning: Children often adopt the behaviors and values of their parents or role models.

Proverbs: wood already touched by fire is not hard to set alight
Meaning: Past experiences make one more susceptible to similar occurrences in the future.

Proverbs: a chick that will grow into a cock can be spotted the very day it hatches
Meaning: Some individuals exhibit characteristics or potential from a young age.

Proverbs: a child's fingers are not scalded by a piece of hot yam which his mother puts into his palm
Meaning: Parents protect and care for their children, ensuring their safety and well-being.

Proverbs: an old woman is always uneasy when dry bones are mentioned in a proverb
Meaning: Certain topics or reminders of mortality can evoke discomfort or anxiety, especially in older individuals.

Proverbs: a man who pays respect to the great paves the way for his own greatness
Meaning: Showing reverence towards accomplished individuals can inspire personal growth.

Proverbs: a proud heart can survive a general failure because such a failure does not prick its pride
Meaning: Pride can shield someone from the emotional impact of failure or setback.

Proverbs: as the dog said, 'if i fall down for you and you fall down for me, it is playing'
Meaning: Mutual cooperation or assistance is natural and reciprocal.

Proverbs: a wise man who knows proverbs, reconciles difficulties (yoruba)
Meaning: Proverbs hold wisdom that can be applied to resolve conflicts or challenges.

Proverbs: do not look where you fell, but where you slipped
Meaning: Focus on identifying the cause of a mistake rather than dwelling on the mistake itself.

Proverbs: if a child washes his hands he could eat with kings
Meaning: Proper preparation and behavior can lead to opportunities for success and acceptance.

Proverbs: if you don't stand for something, you will fall for something
Meaning: Having principles or convictions is essential for avoiding manipulation or deception.

Proverbs: it takes a whole village to raise a child
Meaning: Parenting and upbringing are collective responsibilities that involve the entire community.

Proverbs: looking at a king's mouth one would never think he sucked his mother's breast
Meaning: Appearances can be deceiving; one should not judge solely based on outward impressions.

Proverbs: people should not talk while they are eating or pepper may go down the wrong way
Meaning: Certain actions or behaviors should be avoided in specific contexts to prevent mishaps or misunderstandings.

Proverbs: the lizard that jumped from the high iroko tree to the ground said he would praise himself if no one else did
Meaning: Self-praise may be necessary when recognition from others is lacking.

Proverbs: the mouth which eats does not talk
Meaning: Actions speak louder than words, and someone who benefits from a situation may remain silent.

Proverbs: the sun will shine on those who stand before it shines on those who kneel under them
Meaning: Assertiveness and self-respect lead to success and recognition.

Proverbs: those whose palm-kernels were cracked for them by a benevolent spirit should not forget to be humble
Meaning: Success obtained with the help of others should be acknowledged with humility.

Proverbs: when a man says yes, his chi (personal god) says yes also
Meaning: Personal beliefs or convictions influence one's actions and decisions.

Proverbs: when the moon is shining the cripple becomes hungry for a walk
Meaning: Positive circumstances can inspire and motivate individuals, regardless of their limitations.

Proverbs: you can tell a ripe corn by its look
Meaning: Experience and intuition allow one to recognize qualities or characteristics without explicit evidence.

Proverbs: you must judge a man by the work of his hands
Meaning: Assess someone based on their actions and accomplishments rather than mere appearances or promises.

Proverbs: slow, slow is the way to go/slowness is the better locomotion
Meaning: Proceeding cautiously and steadily is preferable to rushing.

Proverbs: being steady and keen is important when performing given tasks hurry, hurry, has no blessings
Meaning: Rushing or impatience often leads to mistakes and negative outcomes.

Proverbs: more haste less speed
Meaning: Rushing leads to inefficiency and mistakes, ultimately slowing progress.

Proverbs: the remedy for fire is fire
Meaning: Sometimes, a problem can only be solved by confronting it directly or using a similar approach.

Proverbs: tit for tat
Meaning: Responding to an action with a similar action.

Proverbs: a person is people
Meaning: Emphasizes the shared humanity among individuals.

Proverbs: no man is an island
Meaning: Everyone depends on others in some way.

Proverbs: nine is near ten
Meaning: Indicates nearing completion or fullness.

Proverbs: intelligence is an asset. knowledge can be used to better ones life
Meaning: Intelligence is valuable, but applying knowledge is crucial for improvement.

Proverbs: little by little fills up the measure
Meaning: Incremental progress leads to significant achievements.

Proverbs: a great journey is begun by a single mile
Meaning: Every significant accomplishment starts with a small step.

Proverbs: anger brings damage
Meaning: Acting out of anger leads to negative consequences.

Proverbs: the child of a snake is a snake
Meaning: Traits or behaviors are often inherited.

Proverbs: like father like son
Meaning: A child's character or behavior can be expected to resemble that of their parents.

Proverbs: the apple does not fall away from its tree
Meaning: A child usually has a similar character or similar qualities to his or her parents.

Proverbs: habit is a skin
Meaning: It's difficult to change habits once they are established.
